$eref.help: Compiler arguments are applied to all compilers, unless explicitly modified in post processing

___watch.help: monitor source files for changes and recompile.

___outCombinator.help: string to combine arguments that "define" a compiler (environment, environment)

___babelPresets.help: add a preset to the babel loader, between es2015 and stage-0

___chunkFilename.help: If provided, enables code splitting with webpack.require. Examples patterns include  '[id].chunk.js', '[name].chunk.js'

___outPrefix.help: prefix for generated contextual modules. Appended to `out` directory

___entry.help: main entry point for your program, across all contexts

___out.help: destination for compiled bundle. If there are multiple, the destination of specific bundles will be decided by the --combinator

$eref.help: Cartesian arguments are array arguments that generate compilers equal to the unorderd cartesian product between them

___environments.help: an application lifecycle environment {DEVELOPMENT, PRODUCTION, etc} this distribution will run in

___contexts.help: a context {NODE, BROWSER, etc} this distribution will run in.

$eref.help: Task arguments are arguments that are fed to the task manager

___logLevel.help: VERBOSE will output webpack stats and warnings

___run.help: Which context to run on compilation, if any

___task.help: the task to run. If non is specified, it will be inferred from other arguments.

___runner.help: Which runner to run the selected compiler with, if any

$eref.help: Presets are functions that apply default or derived arguments at various stages of parsing, loaded from the module given as an argument from the export of the given preset.

___preset.help: module from which to import ALL of the potential presets (any missing presets will be identities)
